J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

>
>Does the compiler have as much information to help us uncover unhandled 
>exceptions? No. 
>
>That's why we have tests. The compiler ain't so damn smart, anyhow.
>

It's only as smart as the Java Language Spec allows it to be.  I usually 
want it to do what I want, not what I say.  

Think of it as just having a good memory.

;-)

Mike
